results.title: The Princess and the cobbler
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams, Richard Sutton, Imogen Sutton and Allied Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Set in a faraway land of magnificent palaces and beautiful Princesses, a sly thief, a shy cobbler and some very ugly brigands, do battle with an evil sorcerer to save a kingdom and rescue a beautiful princess. Following the tradition of “Aladdin” and “Ali Baba”, this animation is exciting family entertainment, with a wonderful musical score featuring the voices of Bobbi Page and Steve Lively, from “Beauty and the beast” and Vincent Price as the evil Zig Zag.

results.title: La Ronde = Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Roger Vadim, Raymond Hakim and Robert Hakim
results.brief_description: La Ronde is a romantic drama with an all-star cast lead by Jane Fonda, Jean Sorel and Catherine Spaak. It is set in pre-World War I Paris when the city was caught in a fever pitch of gaiety and affairs of the heart. Based on Arthur Schintzler’s famous stage play “Reigen”, the screenplay is given a fresh viewpoint by applying French psychology to the pursuit of love in its various forms. Dubbed in English.

results.title: March of the wooden soldiers = Babes in Toyland
results.creator_credit: Gus Meins, Charles Rogers, Hal Roach and Federal Films
results.brief_description: Laurel and Hardy are well-meaning toymakers who muddle an order for Santa. Instead on making one 600 foot high soldier, they make one hundred six-foot soldiers instead. The toy army comes in handy when Barnaby and his furry Bogeymen invade Toyland. The boys end up as heroes as they save Widow Peep’s daughter Bo. Originally known as “Babes in Toyland”, the film was heavily censored as it was considered too scary for children, and it was seldom seen after the Disney remake of 1963. Nevertheless, it remained one of Laurel and Hardy’s best films and it was the personal favourite of Hardy.

results.title: Triumph of the spirit
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Shimon Arama, Arnold Kopelson and Nova International
results.brief_description: The unimaginable horror of Auschwitz is compelling recreated in this overwhelming and powerful story about fighting for survival. Salamo Arouch (Willem Dafoe) is a Greek boxer who fought in the Olympics and is sent to the Auschwitz death camp. There he must battle every day against the inevitability of death with courage and an undaunted will to live being his only weapons. His struggle is a real “Triumph of the spirit.” Co-starring Edward James Olmos and Robert Loggia.

results.title: Freaks
results.brief_description: This controversial film was banned for over thirty years in some countries, including Australia. Using a group of circus and carnival performers who were all regarded as “freaks of nature” this unsettling film is about a malicious young woman who weds a carnival manager in order to gain his wealth. Her cruel treatment of the various circus performers prompts them to exact a vicious revenge. The final scenes in this movie are possibly some of the most harrowing in horror cinema history.

results.title: Gross misconduct
results.creator_credit: George Miller, David Hannay, Richard Sheffield-MacClure, Underworld Productions, David Hannan Productions and Pro Films
results.brief_description: Justin Thorn (Jimmy Smits) was a popular university professor, envied by his colleagues and desired by his students. Then one young woman’s desire proves to be too great. Jennifer Carter (Naomi Watts) develops an intense infatuation which results in an encounter that gets out of control and ultimately leads to Thorn being charged with her violent rape. Now his career, his family and his freedom are in jeopardy - but was he really the rapist? The plot twists in this explosive and controversial thriller which will mesmerise and haunt you. Co-starring Sarah Chadwick as Thorn’s suffering wife and Brendon Suhr as Carter’s maligned boyfriend.

results.title: Truly madly deeply
results.creator_credit: Anthony Minghella, Robert Cooper and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Acclaimed British actors Juliet Stevenson and Alan Rickman star in this wonderfully moving story of love, loss and letting go. Nina lives in her rat-infested flat where she spends most of her time grieving for her dead lover, Jamie. As if in answer to her dreams, Jamie re-enters her life but Nina discovers that living in the past could mean a life without a future.

results.title: World of Apu = World of Apu
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray and Satyajit Ray Production
results.brief_description: The third in the Apu trilogy, the scene opens in Calcutta, where Apu, now a jobless ex-student, dreams of becoming a writer. Extracted from this insular environment, Apu’s life changes when he visits a village and exchanges himself for the mad bridegroom. After his wife’s death during childbirth, Apu leaves Calcutta. His life becomes one filled with indifference. Apu’s journey back to the world is painful but ultimately fulfilling. This is a moving film, considered to be one of Ray’s best, perhaps because the theme is so profound: that without death there cannot be life. The music by Ravi Shankar adds to the film’s power. Based on the text by Bibhutibhusan Banerji.

results.title: Major league (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David S. Ward, Irby Smith, Chris Chesser and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: The recently widowed, and new owner of the Cleveland Indians has a plan: field the worst team ever, watch the attendance fall, then move the franchise to glorious sun-drenched Miami. So she signs a punk-pitcher (Charlie Sheen), a gimpy-kneed womanising catcher (Tom Berenger), a third-rate third baseman (Corbin Bernsen), the outfielder Willie May Hates (Wesley Snipes) and a ‘wayout’ field of other crazy misfits. The perfect plan? maybe not, but it is the perfect ingredients for this riotous and inspiring comedy.

results.title: Tracks of glory
results.creator_credit: Marcus Cole, Paul D. Barron, Damien Parer and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Starring Cameron Daddo, Phil Morris, Robert Vaughn and Nicholas Eadie, this is a story about two men from opposite ends of the earth; and their ideals, hopes and dreams. In 1903, two men are using their talents to win themselves a place in the sun. Don Walker, a champion Australian cyclist drags himself from the depths of urban poverty to the height of glory. He is a man determined to win on his own terms. American Marshall W. “Major” Taylor, a grandson of slaves, is a dedicated professional and the first black American athlete to smash his way through the colour bar. They have everything to lose and everything to win.
